Whenever you cast a colorless spell, scry 1. Until end of turn, you may look at the top card of your library, and you may cast spells from the top of your library.

You get a soil counter. Then mill X cards, where X is twice the number of soil counters you have. You may return a permanent card with mana value X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
A deck can have any number of cards named Something in the Soil.

Surveil 1, then draw a card. You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.

Counter target instant or sorcery spell. Target player mills cards equal to its mana value.

Each player exiles a card from their hand. You may play cards you exiled this way. Each opponent may pay {2} as a sorcery to put a card they exiled this way into their hand.
Each player discards their hand, then draws cards equal to the greatest number of cards a player discarded this way.
At the beginning of your upkeep, mill a card, then you may pay life equal to its mana value. If you do, put it into your hand.
